embeds.title: Idol of Retromation
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / All / Downfall

At the start of your turn, reduce the cost of the most expensive card in your hand by 1 for this turn.
*Often called the Idol of Reto for short.*

messages.content: a nice boss relic
hard to go wrong with it
basically a slightly weaker energy relic with no downsides, definitely a good pick in almost any circumstance
Yeah an energy relic as long as you play a certain card.
kinda reminds me of a similar energy relic

embeds.title: Short Straw
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / All / Reliquary

At the start of your turn, gain :e_colorless: and choose a random card in your hand. If it's still in your hand at the end of the turn, you lose 10 HP.
*This may not have been the pick.*

messages.content: It gives you 1 effective energy and incentivizes you to play a specific card
one incentivizes you by attaching the energy save to that card, the other by threatening hp loss if you don't play it/discard it.
Reto is overall better because if short straw lands on a status or curse and you don't have a way to get rid of it, you eat 10 damage. That is a pretty nasty downside.
well at least it usually targets the card you are incentivized to play, and the cards that you would want an energy relic for anyways
Overall reto is pretty high reward with no risk.
The only big downside reto has is <snecko eye>

embeds.title: Snecko Eye
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / All / Slay the Spire

At the start of your turn, draw 2 additional cards. Start each combat **Confused**.
*An eye of a fallen snecko. Much larger than you imagined.*

messages.content: I dont think id even consider retro with sneko, or the other way around
I dont think id even consider ~~retro with~~ sneko~~, or the other way around~~
its like the diet coke version of an energy relic
I hate snecko eye with a passion
slightly weaker, but r bette
Honestly I'd say it is probably the best boss relic. It helps you play your 2+ cost cards easier, and those are usually high impact cards that you want to play.
blasphemy against the highest order!
Snecko eye is quite literally the least enjoyable experience in the game
Sneko is great, but it also sucks ass
Just gamble on if you actually get to play the game or not
And without an energy relic you can just roll 2's and 3's only be able to play a single card
Tbh i dont play much sneko on any downfall characters
Its more of a base game kinda relic
Alright back to reto idol. Just free energy unless you choose not to play your high impact cards.
its bassicly <slavers collar> 2.0, a downsideless but conditional energy relic

embeds.title: Slaver's Collar
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / All / Slay the Spire

During Boss and Elite combats, gain :e_colorless: at the start of your turn.
*Rusty miserable chains.*

messages.content: better slavers collar, most of the time
Yeah tell me honestly how often you not play the price reduced card?

It's a very strong energy relic. The downside is that you don't have full choice over how you are spending the 4th energy, so if it reduces an expensive power like heckle or a form card, and you currently being attacked for 30+ damage by tri slavers, you are out of luck that turn. It could also reduce the cost of an expensive block card on a turn where you really want to spend your energy dealing damage instead (turn 1 of triple cultist, turn 1 of reptomancer). The vast majority of the time, that downside doesn't matter very much, and it is definitely true that your most expensive cards are often the ones you want to play anyways, as they tend to have the highest impact. It is extremely rare that I wouldn't take idol of retromation when offered as a boss relic, and it's a very good boss swap. I think it's honestly too good, just because of how rarely the downside matters, but I can't think of an effective way to nerf it, maybe if the cost reduction was completely random?

I don't really see a comparison to slaver's collar. That has a massive downside, which is that all your hallway fights become much tougher. That can easily kill you in act 2 before you even reach your first elite, and is really deadly against the transient in act 3. You basically don't have a boss relic at all in your hallway fights, whereas taking something like astrolabe or empty cage at least improves the consistency/quality of your deck in those fights. Generally I take slavers collar when I feel like my deck is already very good at handling short hallway fights (akabeko, anchor, backstab, immolate+, lantern) anything really that helps you end fights quickly or just generally have very good early turns makes collar more viable.
tiny house is more consistent than slavers collar
how do you expect to be able to path to the elites if you cant get through the hallways
if your deck can get through hallways on 3 energy?
then... why are you taking slaver's collar?

crown
ecto
collar
just a hypothetical

"how do you expect to be able to do X if u cant do Y"
"if u can do Y"
oh
sorry about pulling the "assume a can opener"
btw entirely random cost reduction might be a buff

We've had a discussion on making it random a few months back I think, and overall I think that making it more random would make it less fun and honestly probably stronger. It making a 3 cost go to 2 is nice. It making a 1 cost go to 0 is excellent. It makes it a no brainer that you want to play that card. The only time I'd say it would be a worse result is if it activates on a strike or defend, but that is completely random.
I like the current version because if you add too many 3 costs to your deck you can just get stuck drawing 2-3 of them on the same turn.
I think making it random reduces consistency and often makes it better.
That and it makes removing strikes and defends an even bigger priority, as if that wasn't already pretty important.
Hadn't considered that making it totally random could be considered a buff. What if it automatically reduced the cost of the most common card in your hand?
I feel like that might be a little complicated, and once again emphasizes removing strikes and defends even more than before
